etymologies: early 18th century (in an earlier sense). From scientific Latin pomaceus (from classical Latin pōmum fruit, in post-classical Latin apple + -āceus: see -aceous) + -ous

definitions: Of the nature of a pome; of or relating to the Pomoideae (or Pomeae), a subfamily of the family Rosaceae consisting of trees and shrubs which produce pomes, such as the apple, pear, and hawthorn.
